author: henry-js
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 and PowerShell 7+ issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6).

-->

## Steps to reproduce
Run Update-Help on a module
```powershell
update-help -module microsoft.powershell.core -verbose
```

## Expected behavior

Help should be updated

```none

```

## Actual behavior
All modules that attempt to update resolve to the below default web addresses
```none
VERBOSE: Resolving URI: "https://aka.ms/powershell71-help"
VERBOSE: Your connection has been redirected to the following URI: "https://pshelpprod.blob.core.windows.net/cabinets/powershell-7.1/"
VERBOSE: Resolving URI: "https://aka.ms/powershell71-help"
VERBOSE: Your connection has been redirected to the following URI: "https://pshelpprod.blob.core.windows.net/cabinets/powershell-7.1/"
```

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19043
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: 237dmitry
comments.body:
> Help should be updated

In my environment help is already up to date. For current user's scope:
```powershell
$ update-help -module microsoft.powershell.core -verbose -Scope CurrentUser
VERBOSE: Resolving URI: "https://aka.ms/powershell71-help"
VERBOSE: Your connection has been redirected to the following URI: "https://pshelpprod.blob.core.windows.net/cabinets/powershell-7.1/"
VERBOSE: Performing the operation "Update-Help" on target "Microsoft.PowerShell.Core, Current Version: 7.1.0.0, Available Version: 7.1.0.0, UICulture: en-US".
VERBOSE: Microsoft.PowerShell.Core: The most current Help files are already installed.. Culture en-US Version 7.1.0.0
```

comments.author: henry-js
comments.body:
All my help files for microsoft.powershell.core end with:
```REMARKS
    Get-Help cannot find the Help files for this cmdlet on this computer. It is displaying only partial help.
        -- To download and install Help files for the module that includes this cmdlet, use Update-Help.
        -- To view the Help topic for this cmdlet online, type: "Get-Help Start-Job -Online" or
           go to https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=2096796.
```

comments.author: henry-js
comments.body:
Whoops, I just needed to specify `-UICulture` as `en-US`
Sorry.

title: Update-Help cannot resolve URI's on PowerShell 7.1.3
